page.title: 14THE DENBIGH ESTATE
page.content: The Denbigh Estate covers the western quarter of the block,including four tenanted farms,part of the four & a half thousand acres owned by the 11th Earl.The family house{NEWNHAM PADDOX} was pulled down in the 1950's after a struggle to keep it habitable,now Lord Denbigh & his family live in a stable block conversion.Another change,crops such as corn,potatoes & oil seed rape are grown in some of the 100 acres of Parkland immediately surrounding the house.The magnificant wrought iron gates were restored in 1984,costing Â£12,000,although no longer used.It is hoped to restore a Victorian{ICE HOUSE in 1986.Two{ORNAMENTAL LAKES}(1760) are fed by a stream,the{top lake}was dug out (1979) & stocked with brown & rainbow trout,these died this summer through weed suffication & lack of oxygen.{Lower lake}has carp & tench.
